author: Express News Service
title: 13,874 leopards in India, Madhya Pradesh leads the pack | India News - The Indian Express
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday hailed the significant increase in India's leopard population, saying it is a testament to the country's unwavering dedication to biodiversity. Earlier, Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav released a report on Thursday, according to which India's estimated leopard population rose from 12,852 in 2018 to 13,874 in 2022. Madhya Pradesh has the maximum number of leopards in the country at 3,907 (up from 3,421 in 2018), the report said. Reposting the Environment Minister's post on the report on X, Modi said, “Great news! This significant increase in leopard numbers is a testament to India's unwavering dedication to biodiversity.” “I compliment all those who are part of the various collective efforts towards wildlife protection, paving the way for a sustainable coexistence,” he said. The number of felines grew from 1,690 in 2018 to 1,985 in 2022 in Maharashtra, from 1,783 to 1,879 in Karnataka, and from 868 to 1,070 in Tamil Nadu. “Central India shows a stable or slightly growing leopard population (8,820 in 2022 against 8,071 in 2018), the Shivalik hills and the Indo-Gangetic Plains experienced a decline (from 1,253 in 2018 to 1,109 in 2022),” the environment ministry said in a statement. In Madhya Pradesh, the leopard occupancy increased in the Chambal and Bundelkhand regions with a marginal decline from the Chhindwara forests, the report said, adding, “Panna Tiger Reserve and Kuno National Park exhibit some of the highest leopard densities in India”. The report cautioned that while leopard populations thrive in Madhya Pradesh, “effective vigilance is essential to address both targeted and unintentional poaching… there is a need for the effective implementation of mitigation measures concerning linear infrastructure development projects to ensure the continued well-being of leopard populations in the region,” the report said. The report also showcased that the leopards were able to coexist with tigers in Madhya Pradesh as tiger reserves such as Satpura, Bandhavgarh, Pench, and Kanha also feature high leopard numbers.

author: undefined
title: Oceana inaugura la exposición “Arrecifes de coral, del mar al andén” | El Universal
text:
La organización para la conservación de los océanos, Oceana , en coordinación con la Comisión Nacional de Áreas Protegidas Naturales ( Conam ) llevó a cabo la inauguración de la exposición “Arrecifes de coral, del mar al andén”, la cual estará hasta el 31 de agosto en el Metro La Raza , dirección Indios Verdes, así como al final del Túnel de la Ciencia. “La exposición es una representación artística donde intentamos representar las amenazas a las que están sujetas los arrecifes de coral, un ecosistema muy rico e importante de los ambientes marinos que representan el 25% de la biodiversidad marina”, dijo a EL UNIVERSAL Miguel Rivas, director de Campañas de Santuarios Marinos para Oceana en México.
Explicó que esta exposición pretende celebrar la creación del Parque Nacional Bajos del Norte , que es uno de los ocho parques marinos que hay en México.
Leer también Oceana firmas entrega en el Congreso CDMX 16 mil firmas para exigir la regulación de plásticos desechables del comercio electrónico
El Parque Nacional Bajos del Norte es el área natural protegida más grande del Golfo de México, ubicada en la Península de Yucatán y fue creada este año. Cuenta con una extensión de alrededor de 1.3 millones de hectáreas en el mar, explicó Rivas.
“Es un llamado como sociedad para disminuir las emisiones de carbono y la sobrepesca, y con ello contribuir a que estos ecosistemas ricos sigan existiendo, para que aquí en la Ciudad de México, muy alejados del mar, tomemos conciencia de este ecosistema”, señaló.
La exposición “Arrecifes de coral, del mar al andén” está compuesta por dos vitrinas en el acceso del Metro la Raza, donde en una de ellas hay fotografías de una expedición científica debajo del mar, que llevaron a cabo científicos de la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México (UNAM) y de la Universidad de Arizona.
Exposición “Arrecifes de coral, del mar al anden” en Metro La Raza. Foto: Rafael García En la vitrina principal, hay una representación de este ecosistema acuático, donde hay desde corales, hasta arrecifes, y fue creada por María Pita Camacho, quien plasmó corales degradados para hacer conciencia sobre lo que pasaría si no se toman medidas.
“Se inspiró en un artículo que se hizo con inteligencia artificial, en donde se demuestra cómo los corales van a morir eventualmente si es que no ponemos un poco más de conciencia”, señaló la artista.
Camacho aseguró que le tomó un mes preparar esta exposición, entre tratamiento de materiales y tres más por el montaje de la representación dentro de las vitrinas ubicadas en el Metro La Raza, dirección Indios Verdes .
“Está hecha de diversos materiales, principalmente papel reciclable y de materiales reciclados, un poco de espuma expansiva que se comprime y al momento que pasan los años no va a afectar tampoco al medio ambiente”, dijo.
Leer también ¡Ojo! Pescaderías y restaurantes venden tiburón en lugar de Bacalao, alerta la organización Oceana
Únete a nuestro canal ¡EL UNIVERSAL ya está en Whatsapp!, desde tu dispositivo móvil entérate de las noticias más relevantes del día, artículos de opinión, entretenimiento, tendencias y más.
mahc/cr

author: info@kalkinemedia.com (EIN Presswire)
title: Innovative Technology for Additive Manufacturing and Growth Prospects: Italian Startup 3DNextech at CES 2024
text:
EINPresswire.com/ -- 3DNextech, an Italian emerging force in additive manufacturing, is set to make a resounding mark at CES in Las Vegas, slated from January 9 to 12, 2024. Positioned among the 50 startups within the Italian pavilion, organized by the Italian Trade Agency, 3DNextech aims to unveil its advancements that promise to transform the landscape of 3D printing technology.
The hallmark of 3DNextech's innovation lies in its technology, poised to drastically transform the plastic production chain. By introducing a process capable of making plastic materials malleable, the company resolves the longstanding challenges associated with 3D-printed objects, ensuring high mechanical and functional characteristics. This pioneering technology not only refines the surface finish but also imbues the products with qualities essential for both industrial and consumer applications.
One of 3DNextech's pioneering inventions is the 3DFinisher, a finishing station designed to complement 3D printers. This device meticulously polishes objects, smoothing imperfections, and delivering a finished product that meets the highest standards across various industries, including automotive, design, nautical, and medical sectors.
In addition to providing mechanical advantages to individual products, 3DNextech's technology enables a whole new sustainable production chain for plastic objects. In fact, products with qualities comparable to injection-molded ones can be produced, on site and upon need.
Founded in 2015 as a spin-off from the prestigious Sant'Anna School of Advanced Studies in Pisa, 3DNextech has remained at the forefront of innovation. The company's CEO and founder, Andrea Arienti, shares the core ethos driving their vision: "Sustainability is at the heart of our mission. Zero-kilometer production, the shift from mass production to mass customization, are not just ideals but tangible objectives guiding every decision and project within the company. Major industrial partners and financiers have recognized and supported the solidity of our project in recent years: 2024 is the year in which the growth strategy takes concrete shape, with significant investments and collaborations with companies ready to leverage our innovative solutions.”
As the company embarks on a pivotal year, 2024 marks a phase of exponential growth. 3DNextech plans strategic investments aimed at tripling its team, expanding its research and development initiatives, and ultimately launching a Series A round in early 2025.
3DNextech has received backing from influential entities like A11 Venture and Cassa Depositi e Prestiti, affirming the credibility and robustness of its endeavors. The recent inclusion of 3DNextech as a partner in Electrolux's additive manufacturing program at the Innovation Factory in Porcia stands as a testament to its growing influence and industry recognition. For more information visit
www.3dnextech.com
Roberto Rafaschieri
Blum

title: Social Media Hyper-Targeted Marketing Team Helps You Boost Your Daycare Business
text: Social Media Hyper-Targeted Marketing Team Helps You Boost Your Daycare Business Are you looking to boost your daycare business? Improve your online visibility with LeapEngine's social media management service and your spaces will be full in no time. If you want to attract new families, you will need to invest in a high-quality digital marketing strategy. With LeapEngine, you can stand out from the crowd and let parents know exactly why they should choose you! The social media management service focuses on digital advertising across multiple social media channels, helping your business to amplify its brand voice and boost conversions. Specializing in children’s entertainment, education, and development businesses, LeapEngine prides itself on delivering high ROI. Go to https://leapengine.co/ to find out more. The Rise of Social Media MarketingAccording to research from Sprout Social, social media advertising has now overtaken paid advertising, growing 25% year on year. The total spend on social media advertising is predicted to reach $268 billion by the end of 2023, demonstrating its effectiveness in the digital marketing strategy. With LeapEngine's help, you can enhance your brand visibility and direct more traffic towards your website. “Our team of experts elevate your social media presence, turning followers into loyal advocates and trends into your success story,” says the company. Trained in popular social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram and TikTok, LeapEngine’s digital marketing experts can build you a larger social audience to generate more sales. LeapEngine understands the importance of a high-quality content strategy for engaging a target audience. As part of its social media marketing service, the team at LeapEngine will craft and share blog posts, videos, and infographics on your behalf, which represent your brand voice and core values. In addition, they will manage your social media engagement, keeping on top of likes, shares, comments, and direct messages, to establish meaningful connections and brand loyalty. What Makes LeapEngine Different?LeapEngine has recently signed a licensed agreement with a cutting-edge AI tool developer to deliver dynamically modified product catalog images and hyper-targeted content. By analyzing customer behavior, this technology helps to optimize your content for your target audience based on specific interests, demographics, and characteristics. In addition to social media management, the company offers digital marketing services in search engine optimization, conversion rate optimization, and outreach marketing. One satisfied customer said: “Aya understands our brand and goals which is a very unique quality in the agency space. She is an unbelievably elite marketer who is always bringing new ideas, tests, and opportunities to the table that have successfully grown our business.” Build a unique story for your brand with LeapEngine. Visit https://leapengine.co/ today to find out more.
